definition: can only/obliged to do sth/to have no other choice
grain that has begun to ripen/variant of 衹|只[zhi3]
classifier for birds and certain animals, one of a pair, some utensils, vessels etc
can/to be able to/might possibly/ability/(physics) energy

sentences.english: Has the purple devoted to encourage and comfort can only temporarily soothe her injured heart.
sentences.chinese: 曾紫陌的鼓励和安慰也只能暂时稍稍安抚她受伤的心。

sentences.english: Running our of grain, the army had to live on wild fruit and tree bark.
sentences.chinese: 部队断了粮，只能靠野果和树皮充饥。

sentences.english: He had no choice but to comply, allowing the Imperials aboard.
sentences.chinese: 他别无选择，只能照办，同意帝国检查队登舰。

sentences.english: There were no entrances or exits, and players could only leave by hearthing out;
sentences.chinese: 既没有入口也没有出口，玩家只能炉石出去。

sentences.english: Pure is in one kind of bone thing, installs only can call affectedly .
sentences.chinese: 纯真是一种骨子里的东西，装出来的只能叫矫揉造作。

sentences.english: Most boxers can fight only five rounds because this kind of fighting is very difficult.
sentences.chinese: 大多数拳击手只能打五轮，因为这种拼斗非常困难。

sentences.english: Please note that the activation code can be used only on a single phone and is not transferrable .
sentences.chinese: 请注意激活码只能在一台手机上使用，不可以传递。

sentences.english: The prototypes they have now let you fly a whole 30 seconds.
sentences.chinese: 现在研究出来的原型机只能让你飞整整的30秒。

sentences.english: On WHT and many other places, you only hear about it when it messes up.
sentences.chinese: 在西隧和许多其他地方，你只能听到它时它弄乱。

sentences.english: This key is one use only IIRC.
sentences.chinese: 简单的说，钥匙只能用一次。

sentences.english: Passion alone cannot win the revolution; Passion just makes martyrs.
sentences.chinese: 光靠满腔热血，不会使革命成，只能制造烈士。

sentences.english: We were all told to say that she was a lodger.
sentences.chinese: 要是别人问起来，我们只能说她是“一个租客”。

sentences.english: The slave might be your business manager, but all the slave could do is the paperwork.
sentences.chinese: 就算他为你管理生意，也只能做做文书工作。

sentences.english: If you spend all the money you get, you will have to depend on pension when old.
sentences.chinese: 若把所有钱都“月光”掉，老了将只能靠养老金。

sentences.english: Right now, Hockaday's prototypes put out only a few milli- watts of power.
sentences.chinese: 现在，霍克蒂的燃料电池原型只能输出几毫瓦的电力。

sentences.english: Like a little hamster, who once spend his days in a RV pank.
sentences.chinese: 比如一只小仓鼠，每天都只能在一个旅行车场度日。

definition: there is nothing to be done/one can't do anything about it
without any better option/to have to/to be forced to
at a loss/unable to do anything about it/to have no choice
have no choice or option but to/cannot but/have to/can't help it/can't avoid
helpless/without choice/for lack of better option/grudgingly/willy-nilly/nolens volens/abbr. for 無可奈何|无可奈何[wu2 ke3 nai4 he2]
also/too/(in Classical Chinese) final particle implying affirmation
again/once more/re-/second/another/then (after sth, and not until then)/no matter how ... (followed by an adjective or verb, and then (usually) 也[ye3] or 都[dou1] for emphasis)
but/yet/however/while/to go back/to decline/to retreat/nevertheless/even though
grain that has begun to ripen/variant of 衹|只[zhi3]
classifier for birds and certain animals, one of a pair, some utensils, vessels etc
